page.title: 07MOAT HOUSE FARM
page.content: The old moat{farm,Stapleton}stands raised on a plinth of stone some fifteen to twenty feet above the level of the surrounding fields.The moat which no doubt at one time was filled with water to a level half way up the plinth,has long since dried up and an untended orchard has taken its place on two sides.The ground is boggy and spongy to the N.W except where an old brick bridge has fallen in and become part of the cart way leading under the square opening of the ancient gateway. A few years ago a tudor gate-house stood above the masive timbers of the opening.In Domesday times,the lord of the manor lived here,vasals of the Earl Roger de Montgomery,cousin and tenant in capite of King William.There is little doubt that the moat farm stands on the original site of a moat the meeting place of saxon elders.
